EnablingAuthority.XRefExternal: LIBRARY AND ARCHIVES OF CANADA ACT

Provision.Text: The Minister of Canadian Heritage, pursuant to subsection 10(2) of the Library and Archives of Canada Acta, hereby makes the annexed Legal Deposit of Publications Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Library and Archives of Canada Act. (Loi)

publisher means a person who makes a publication available in Canada that the person is authorized to reproduce or over which the person controls the content. It does not include a person who only distributes a publication. (éditeur)

Section.Text: In order to make a publication and its contents that uses a medium other than paper accessible to the Librarian and Archivist, the publisher shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before providing a copy of the publication to the Librarian and Archivist,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: decrypt encrypted data contained in the publication, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: remove or disable security systems or devices that are designed to restrict or limit access to the publication; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when providing a copy of the publication to the Librarian and Archivist,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: provide a copy of software specifically created by the publisher that is necessary to access the publication,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provide a copy of technical or other information necessary to access the publication, including a copy of manuals that accompany the publication, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: provide any available descriptive data about the publication including its title, creator, language, date of publication, format, subject and copyright information.

Section.Text: The following classes of publications are those in respect of which, except where a publication is also in a class described in section 4, only one copy is required to be provided under section 10 of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: musical sound recordings;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: multi-media publications consisting of two or more physical parts in different formats;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: publications of which fewer than 100 copies have been produced;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: publications produced on demand from a master copy of which fewer than 100 copies have been produced; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: online publications.

Section.Text: The following classes of publications are those in respect of which the obligation to provide two copies under subsection 10(1) of the Act applies only on a written request from the Librarian and Archivist:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: publications, other than online publications, of which fewer than four copies have been produced;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: printed publications that are manufactured or distributed in Canada and that are not published under the imprint of a Canadian publisher;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sound recordings that are manufactured or distributed in Canada and that have no Canadian content or major Canadian contributor such as a composer, artist, narrator, conductor, orchestra, performer, writer, lyricist or producer;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: reissues or portions of publications that are not substantially different from copies already deposited;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: newspapers printed on paper;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: programs of activities and events;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: publications, including livres d’artiste or book objects, produced by the author, the artist or the publisher using a creative process that significantly distinguishes each copy from the others;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: trade catalogues, advertisements, promotional material, prospectuses and price lists;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: timetables of transport services;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: blank books or blank forms without accompanying text;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: calendars and agendas without accompanying text;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: galley copies, works-in-progress, preprints and drafts;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: student reports, theses and other works produced to meet course requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: drawing and colouring books without text and books of cut-outs for children;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: press releases and circulars;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: newsletters of local interest, in particular those that are published by associations, parishes, employee groups, union locals or schools;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: minutes of meetings and by-laws;

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: posters and banners;

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: patterns, models, plans and blueprints;

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: bookmarks;

Paragraph.Label: (u)
Paragraph.Text: postcards;

Paragraph.Label: (w)
Paragraph.Text: games;

Paragraph.Label: (x)
Paragraph.Text: deliberations of electronic discussion groups, listservs, bulletin boards and e-mails;

Paragraph.Label: (y)
Paragraph.Text: websites, including portals, personal websites, service sites, intranets and websites consisting primarily of links to other sites; and

Paragraph.Label: (z)
Paragraph.Text: dynamic databases and raw data.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on January 1, 2007.
